subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Vesting: Earning Your Own Shares
description: A fast breakdown of Vesting: Earning Your Own Shares for builders.

hook.text: A co-founder quits after 6 months and keeps 50% of the company. Without vesting, this is legal.

buildup.text: Vesting means shares are earned over time, typically 4 years with a 1-year cliff.

discovery.text: The cliff: if you leave before year one, you get nothing. After that, shares vest monthly.

twist.text: Vesting protects everyoneâ€”including founders from each other. It's the seatbelt of equity.

climax.text: Even Mark Zuckerberg had a vesting schedule. It's standard, not insulting.

punchline.text: Vesting means you earn ownership by staying and contributing.

quiz.question: What is a 'cliff' in a vesting schedule?
options: A period (usually one year) before which no shares vest at all
The maximum number of shares that can vest
A penalty for leaving the company early
